rooms.Name: Entrance to Turnings of the Wheel
rooms.Description:
The Wheel of Time turns, and Ages come and pass, leaving memories that become
legend. Legend fades to myth, and even myth is long forgotten when the Age
that gave it birth comes again. In one Age, called the third Age by some, an
Age yet to come, an Age long past, a wind rose in the Mountains of Mist. The
wind was not the beginning.  There are neither beginnings nor ending to the
turning of the Wheel of Time. The wind was not the beginning.  There are
neither beginnings nor ending to the turning of the Wheel of Time.

rooms.Name: Quarry Road, by Tam's House
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a well kept road beside an average looking farm house.
It looks like a major battle was once held here judging by the hacked off
branches and brown stains on the stony ground. A cold wind blows off the
Mountains of Mist far to the west. To your west you see Tam's house and to
the east the road continues into the West Wood.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The ladder looks like its of simple downhome contruction. Unfortunately it
also looks very unsafe.

Made of a combination of boards and split logs this house looks quite rustic.
The thatched roof of the home looks well repaired and maintained. A ladder
attached to the side of the house makes you think the house has been recently
repaired.

rooms.Name: Tam's Barn
rooms.Description:
You walk carefully through Tam's Barn.  The Trollocs took a savage toll on
Tam's cattle when they went to seize Rand.  Brown stains mark the place where
Tam's cattle used to be milked in the morning.  The horse stalls look like
they have been repaired well and are in good condition.  Near the center Tam
has constructed a storage bin to store food for the winter.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Although empty, the stall has been repaired well and is waiting for Bela's
return.

rooms.Name: Tam's Kitchen
rooms.Description:
Tam and Rand have used this kitchen ever since the building of the house long
ago.  Much like any other farm's kitchen, pots and pans lie slightly concealed
in a row of cabinet near the kitchen fire and dishes lay in a wash basin to
be cleaned later.  The room has been carefully repaired by Tam's loving hand.
It looks like Tam is making dinner here as things are left out on the
counter.

rooms.Name: Tam's Room
rooms.Description:
You stand in a simple room with few adornments.  A closet stands in the
southwest corner, but contains nothing useful.  A large king size bed with a
bump on one side lies in the center of the room.  A fairly well painted
picture lies on the far west wall depicting Tam's long dead wife.  She was
certainly beautiful even for being a foreigner.

rooms.Name: Rand's old room
rooms.Description:
Abandoned for over a month now, this room shows signs of the vicious attack
inflicted by the Trollocs.  Shelves lie fallen and snapped on the west end,
and a bed cleanly broken in three places sits in the center.  The only thing
of interest that the room contains is a small table in one corner of the room
with a note on it reading, "Rand's stuff I mean to fix sometime."

ExtraDescs.Description: The note reads, "Rand's stuff I mean to fix sometime." and is signed Tam.

rooms.Name: Tam's Front Room
rooms.Description:
After the cold wind of the Quarry Road, Tam's house is a welcome relief.  A
warm fire burns on the hearth, and makes you feel very much at home.  A scant
amount of furniture adorns the room, all bearing signs of repair from much
use.  Wonderful smells waft at you from the kitchen to the west and it looks
like there's a bedroom to the south.  There's a small staircase here.

ExtraDescs.Description: It looks sturdy. It lead's up to Rand's room and then the attic.

rooms.Name: Tam's Attic
rooms.Description:
Dust covers everything here.  Chest and wooden crates line the walls here
containing old wool and broken fragments of furniture cleared out from the
rest of the house after the attack. A table on one side of the room holds
what looks like old clothing from Tam's wife. You can see light coming from
below.

rooms.Name: Tam's Sheep pin
rooms.Description:
The winter and Trolloc attacks have been hard on all the farms of the West
Wood.  Hungry wolves and bears descend from the mountains and forest to
ravage the sheep pens.  Never the less, Tam has managed to keep a dozen sheep
or so safe from the attacks so far.  The grass is very low here.

rooms.Name: Quarry Road, a path through West Wood
rooms.Description:
Winter has been hard on the land.  Although it is late into spring the only
sign of green around you is from the hearty evergreen and fur trees.  Brown,
crisp thorn bushes cloak the outskirts of the road and nettles are the only
things in the undergrowth that has survived.  No birds or squirrels stir in
the trees except those fouled by the dark one.   To your north and south you
see glowing eyes through the darkness of the trees. In the distance you can
see Emond's Field to your west.

ExtraDescs.Description: It looks like a quaint little farm village.

rooms.Name: West Wood, Knot of Trees
rooms.Description:
The icy wind plays strong here as it howls though leafless trees of various
types.  As you pick your way carefully through the nettles and thorn bushes
dotting the undergrowth you feel the presence of the strange eyes on you. The
paw prints of wolves betray their presence in the area.  To your north you
see the relative safety of Quarry Rode through the trees.

rooms.Name: West Wood, Bloody clearing
rooms.Description:
As you walk into the clearing you are immediately repulsed by the image of a
traveler half torn apart by wolves.  Even though the corpse has been dead for
several hours the wolves are still fighting for bits of meat and bone. Blood,
gore, and tattered shards of clothing dot the vegetation.  To your south you
see the much safer confines of Quarry Road.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The traveler has been completely torn apart, organs, blood and bone marrow
coat the area.  If you didn't know better you'd swear it was old Bili.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Near Nynaeve's House
rooms.Description:
After the harshness of the West Wood Emond's Field is a welcome relief.  An
air of festival delights the air as the citizens prepare for a long awaited
Bel Tine. Small children and dogs play together in the street, and even the
adults wear smiles.  In every yard rugs hang from clothes lines, as young and
old alike prepare to start the traditional spring-cleaning.  To the north you
see the home of the Village Wisdom, Nynaeve, and to the south you see an
average looking house.  The road continues east, leading deeper into Emond's
Field.

ExtraDescs.Description: It looks cozy and well kept.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Average Looking House
rooms.Description:
This house, like most others in Emond's Field, has a thatched roof and a warm
fireplace. Despite being clean the home seems to emit a strange unpleasant
odor. A piece of parchment adorns the wall which reads, "Welcome to the
Coplin home".  After reading the parchment that funny smell finally makes
sense. The Coplins are known throughout the Two Rivers for their total lack
of wisdom and the extra portion of BS that the creator endowed them with. To
the north you can see the street.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Nynaeve's House
rooms.Description:
Books, scrolls, and packets of herbs cram the many shelves of this larger
then normal house.  Four beds used to lay the wounded are on the far west
end, and a desk lies near the door to assist the Wisdom in her duties.
Nynaeve's ever-famous "stick she likes to thump people with" lies in a
display case at one end of the room.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You see a hard wooden cane.  Many a village council member has felt the cane
on their heads.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, By the Spring Pole
rooms.Description:
A huge firtree towers over you.  Stripped of all its bark and branches the
tree is set in a deep hole, and will be used during Bel Tine. The unmarried
women of the village will dance around the pole and tie colored ribbons to it
while the unmarried men sing.  After the ribbons are tied to the pole the men
and women that wish to become engaged dance together around the bonfires that
will soon surround the green.  The dance seals the commitment. To the north
you see the charred ruins of a house, and to the south you see the Congar
House.  The street continues to the east towards the green.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Congar House
rooms.Description:
As you enter the Congar home the smell of freshly baked apple pie wafts up at
you from the kitchen.  Although the Congars are as well known as the Coplins
for their negative traits, Daisy Congar does a better then average job in the
kitchen.  The house is spotless, and looks like it has been completely
repaired despite its near destruction after the Trolloc attack nearly a month
ago.  There are few furnishings despite the cleanliness, Wit must not be
doing his job.

ExtraDescs.Description: The furniture looks badly made and uncomfortable.

The apple pie looks like it has been made with loving care.  It smells
delicious!

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Charred Ruin
rooms.Description:
You pick your way carefully as you step through the ashes and charred wooden
fragments of a once beautiful home.  Originally the home of the Village
Blacksmith, this home has been scavenged as much as possible for any item of
value.  It is said that the blacksmith is building a new house despite
Perrin's departure from the Two Rivers.

ExtraDescs.Description: There is nothing left that has any value.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Green
rooms.Description:
Despite the long winter this small patch of ground has been carefully kept
clear and nurtured by the Winespring of which the local Inn is famous for.
Children play at the edges of the field as the town's adults prepare contests
of various types to be held during Bel Tine.  The atmosphere is light and
full of joy despite the coolness of the temperature. To the north you see the
outskirts of the green, and to the south you see a bonfire.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Bel Tine Bonfire
rooms.Description:
A huge mound of wood sits here just begging to be set ablaze as the couples
of Bel Tine join up and begin the dance that will eventually lead to
marriage. Young boys and girls dance and play together here as others
practice songs of Bel Tine.  The sounds of a quarterstaff contest emanate
from the north.

ExtraDescs.Description: Wow. There's a lot of wood here.  Too bad you can't pick it up.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Outskirts of the Green
rooms.Description:
Half grass and half cleared dirt, this section of the town is a common area
for all those that wish to run and play games.  From here you can see the
famous Winespring Inn, and have a clear view nearly to the Waterwood in the
far east.  Although the men, of the village do not know it, the Women's
Council often meets here when the weather isn't bad.  Lately their talk has
been about the best way to skin Wit alive for meddling with them.

rooms.Name: Emond's Field, Wagon Bridge
rooms.Description:
Large enough for a wagon, the Wagon Bridge is aptly named.  As the bridge
crosses the Winespring so changes the road to your north from the North Road
to the Old Road as one goes southward.  No one ever questions it though, as
it's been that way since the days of Manetherin. Far to the east you can see
the Winespring gurgle away from its spring here in Emond's Field and become
the Winespring Water as it makes its way to flood the marshes of the
Waterwood.  To the southeast you see the glittering tile roof of the
Winespring Inn, and to the north you see the North Road as its makes its way
to Watch Hill. Sounds of contest ring from southwest.

rooms.Name: Winespring Inn, Common Room
rooms.Description:
The focal point of the village and the seat of power for the local
government, the Winespring Inn's Common Room is the place of discussion.
Here the Village Council meets, and sits by the fire. In the western corners
sit tables near the kitchen where guests of the Inn can sit and be served
meals cooked by the best cook in all of the Two Rivers. A staircase in the
north end of the room leads to the guestroom upstairs. A small door leads
southward into the stables, and a doorway to the east appears to lead to a
small office.

Exits.Description: It looks like it leads to the stable

rooms.Name: Winespring Inn, Mayor's Office
rooms.Description:
Cramped, and somewhat over burdened by classy furniture this small office
never the less serves its purpose very well.   Used more often as a place to
change money from foreigners then to deal with local politics it also serves
as a sort of bank for the community.  A full scale sits atop Bran's Favorite
desk.

ExtraDescs.Description: The mayor uses this scale to weigh the currency from other countries.

rooms.Name: Winespring Inn, Stable
rooms.Description:
No traveler could ever doubt that his or her horse would get royal treatment
at the Winespring Inn.  Stable boys check the horses every hour to insure
they are comfortable and well fed.  Currently the stable is devoid of horses.

Exits.Description: It looks like it leads to the Inn.

rooms.Name: Winespring Inn, Kitchen
rooms.Description:
Sweet delicious smells pour from this room like water pours from the
Winespring.  Extremely well stocked even in this long winter season, the
Winespring's kitchen is no exeption. The head cook, Mrs. Al'Vere is known to
be the nicest woman in all of the Two Rivers. With honey cakes baking in a
stone oven, you are tempted to give her a big hug.

ExtraDescs.Description: The smell coming from the oven is delicious as the honey cakes bake.

rooms.Name: Winespring Inn, Guest Room
rooms.Description:
All that you'd expect from a guestroom is here. A comfortable looking bed
with a carved wooden headboard dominates about half of the room. The rest of
the room is take up mainly by a metal wash basin, various cabinets, and
closets.  The room is spotlessly clean. You can hear the sounds of the common
room from down below.

rooms.Name: North Road, Half-way to Watch Hill
rooms.Description:
After traveling for what seems forever, you finally reach the halfway mark to
Watch Hill As you travel north the road gets more and more hilly. Maybe
your mind is just playing tricks on you but you think you hear the sound of a
Draghkar.  The Road Continues to the north towards Watch Hill.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Fast and deadly, the Draghkar are horrible winged demons.  The Draghkar serve
as both spies and shock troops for Fades and the Dark One himself.

rooms.Name: North Road, By Watch Hill
rooms.Description:
As you walk north you notice the great Watch Hill. Towering over the other
landscape nearby, the Watch Hill serves as a resting-place to those weary of
travel.  Atop the hill is a small village.  To the north the road continues
to Taren Ferry.  You have the ever-present feeling you are being watched.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The village twinkles with lights in the darkness.  From here it looks small,
and insignificant.

rooms.Name: North Road, Half-Way to Taren Ferry
rooms.Description:
A knot of trees share space along this road with a huge tangle of brambles.
Dark shapes move in the undergrowth made more sinister by a decaying body
lying in the road. The sound of hoofs stamping on the hard dirt of the North
Road makes you jump.  You can't seem to make any connection with the sound.
The road continues north to Taren Ferry.

ExtraDescs.Description: It looks freshly killed.

rooms.Name: Village of Taren Ferry
rooms.Description:
Finally after much traveling you have reached the Village of Taren Ferry.
Strange houses loom above you on all sides.  Built high to avoid floodwaters
during the summer rain, the Village of Taren is mainly a merchant town.
Citizens look down from their houses and stick their noses up at you for
being from the Two Rivers.  To the north you can see the Taren Ferry.

rooms.Name: Taren Ferry
rooms.Description:
Fog surrounds you on all sides as you step towards the Taren Ferry.  A small
line sits waiting on the dock for the ferry to come in.  A portly man stands
here taking the money, and ushering the people onto the ferry.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Hmm, it looks like Master Hightower has yet to fix that damage that Moiraine
did to the ferry. It looks like you'll have to swim if you want to get to the
other side of the river.

rooms.Name: On to Baerlon, bank of the Taren
rooms.Description:
After leaving the Taren you find yourself standing on a gently sloping bank.
Here the land is shrouded in a carpet of salty fog that stretches along the
Taren for miles in both directions.  Through the mist you see a forest to the
north.

ExtraDescs.Description: The forest looks dark, yet comforting.

rooms.Name: On to Baerlon, Woods
rooms.Description:
Often flooded by the Taren, the soil of this area is very rich. Depite the
long hard winter, a few new trees have started to grow here among towering
pine trees.  Branches thicken the shadows here and the sky is almost
completely blocked out. To the west you see a cave made by many fallen trees
and to the north the forest turns to road.  The sound of flowing water fills
your ears from the south.

rooms.Name: Lan's encampment
rooms.Description:
Secluded from the forest, this cave is serving as a camp for Lan and
Moiraine.  A campfire blazes merrily in a circle of stone near the center of
the cave, carefully guarded to prevent light from reaching outside. Leather
leaf trees encircle the fallen trees that comprise the cave, casting strange
shadows in the moonlight.  Stony Runes of power encircle the camp, acting as
magical sentinels. A path leads west, back into the forest.

ExtraDescs.Description: The campfire adds light to the room.
Made by Aes Sedai, these runes prevent Trollocs and Fades from entering.

rooms.Name: On to Baerlon, hill overlooking Baerlon
rooms.Description:
After many days of travel you finally stop to get your bearings. The ground
here is hilly, and in the distance you can see hundreds of roofs.
Silhouetted in the setting sun, the City of Baerlon is easily three times the
size of Emond's Field. A huge wall surrounds the town, ending in gates on the
south and east sides.  To your north you see the great south gate of Baerlon.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, South gate
rooms.Description:
Towering above you the south gate lies open here.  Guarded carefully, this
busy gate admits people at almost any time of day. A drawbridge crosses a
moat here, providing a first line of defense before the gate. The city of
Baerlon stretches before you to the north.

ExtraDescs.Description: It looks like the moat is filled with ravenous gators.  Better not fall in!

rooms.Name: Baerlon, Narrow Street
rooms.Description:
Barely the width of two wagons this dirty street is bordered by high fences
on both sides. Empty warehouses and run down shops flank the corners of the
street.  The fence to the west looks like it might have a hole in it big
enough for you to squeeze through.  You think you hear, "Walk in the Light"
coming from the alley to the northwest.   Before you the street continues.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, Center of Town
rooms.Description:
Spanning in all directions, the heart of town is much better off than the
entrance.  Among the crowd on the streets you see members of almost every
nation of the world.  Foreign merchants in strange clothing try to hawk
strange clothing and foodstuffs to weary citizens. As you walk through the
crowd you hear snatches of conversation about the Stag & Lion Inn, a local
inn famous for its hospitality.  The road splits north and east here.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, North center
rooms.Description:
A cold wind blows here from the rooftops from the mountains to the far West.
Weaving in and out of human traffic travelers pull hats and cloaks tighter
over their heads to avoid the chill as if blown along like leaves in fall.
Here and there a man dressed in a long white cloak assaults a citizen only to
be quickly subdued by the city guards. In the distance you can see the east
bridge to the east.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, North West corner
rooms.Description:
Sheltered by the strong walls to the west and north, the wind is much lighter
here.  A strange mix of sweet, sour, and sharp smells all mixed together
pervades the area from the strange inns surrounding you.  The smells make you
long for the Winespring Inn back in Emond's Field.  A few barrels have fallen
here, splattering mud on a couple of the Children of Light.  A dark alley
stretches to the south.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, Dark Alley
rooms.Description:
In the shadow of two tall buildings this alley seems to pervade a sense of
evil.  Strange men in white cloaks talk to a figure cloaked completely in
black with a fearsome appearance.  You feel uneasy here. To the southeast you
see Narrow street, and to the north you see the north west corner of town.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, Before east gate
rooms.Description:
Bleak and empty, this simple street is only populated by the ever present
Whitecloaks.  As you walk by an officer accuses an old woman of being a
darkfriend. To the east you see the east gate, and to the south you see the
Stag & Lion.

Exits.Description: It looks like the east gate

rooms.Name: Baerlon, In front of the Stag & Lion
rooms.Description:
Directly to the south you see the massive Stag & Lion Inn.  Famous for its
hospitality, the Stag & Lion caters to people of all nations.  To the west
you see the center of town, and to the south you see the inn.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Common room
rooms.Description:
Much like the common room of the Winespring Inn, this common room is a place
where weary travelers can sit and get a bite to eat.  A cheery gleeman stands
here chanting tales from the Age of Legends, and songs of the hunt for the
horn.  A staircase leads up to the guestrooms, and to the west you see the
kitchen.  A door leads out to the north.

ExtraDescs.Description: He seems to be less lively when the white cloaks are in the room.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Kitchen
rooms.Description:
A cheery, plump looking woman stands here making delightful smelling foods.
Pots and pans sit on hooks, and look well used.  To the southwest you see a
door to the stable, and to the northwest you see a backyard.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Stable
rooms.Description:
As you walk in you admire the large, well-stocked stalls.  A large rack lies
against the wall containing various harnesses, riding crops, and other items.
To the northeast you can see and smell the kitchen.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Backyard
rooms.Description:
Whoever did the landscaping here knew what they were doing.  Despite the
winter, flowers grow here among soft green grasses.  An innocent looking
woman stands beside a doorframe here looking back at you.  To the southeast
you can see and smell the kitchen.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, By doorframe
rooms.Description:
Standing beside a doorframe, the girl makes strange gestures and convulsions.
After a moment or two she acts more normally and looks at you as if you were
a thousand miles away.  To the south you see the backyard. A strange haze
covers the east.

Exits.Description: It looks like it is of magical origin.

rooms.Name: Min's Vision
rooms.Description:
Swirling mist surrounds you as you step into Min's Vision. Strange auras and
a haze of neon colors cloak everything you see.  Three strange people stand
here. To the west you can get out of the vision.

Exits.Description: It looks like it's of magical origin.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Hallway
rooms.Description:
After climbing the stairs you stand in a small hallway with rooms to the
south and north.  A small staircase leads to the roof of the inn.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Empty Room
rooms.Description:
All that you'd expect from a guestroom is here. A comfortable looking bed
with a carved wooden headboard dominates about half of the room. The rest of
the room is take up mainly by a metal wash basin and various cabinets, and
closets.  The room is spotlessly clean. You can hear the sounds of the common
room from down below.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Rand's Room
rooms.Description:
At first glance you notice something strange, the room is covered in dead
rats with broken backs.  Something strange has happened here. A comfortable
looking bed with a carved wooden headboard dominates about half of the room.
The rest of the room is take up mainly by a metal wash basin and various
cabinets, and closets. You can hear the sounds of the common room from down
below. For some odd reason a mirror is mounted on the ceiling.

Exits.Description:
The mirror has a strange unearthly glow to it.  It looks like it leads to
some far corner of hell.

ExtraDescs.Description:
The mirror has a strange unearthly glow to it.  It looks like it leads to
some far corner of hell.

rooms.Name: Stag & Lion, Roof
rooms.Description:
From your point at the top of the Inn you can see the surrounding area around
Baerolon.  In the east you see huge dark shapes moving in the forest.  A
large gale of cold wind blows violently off the mountains to the west.  A
carpet of clouds obscures the north. There is a stairway down to the guest
area.

rooms.Name: Rand's Hell
rooms.Description:
Like something out of a nightmare you stand in a room cloaked in black
colored flames.  A shape sits behind a table of carved marble offering you a
chalice of blood.  You feel like running for your life.

rooms.Name: Baerlon, East Gate
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the east gate of the City of Baerlon. Due to many
problems with the drawbridge here, a board has been laid across the moat
leading slightly south of the normal route the bridge took. (The guards can
now more easily destroy the bridge should the need arise.) On the otherside
of the moat dark shapes give you a sense of danger.  You feel the city guards
may soon block travel out of the city because of the danger.  To the west you
can enter the city through a large iron gate.

Exits.Description: It looks like the East Gate.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Dark trail
rooms.Description:
The huge limbs of many Trollocs cleave brambles and trees asunder here.  A
dark trail leads to the east, and into greater danger. Baerlon lies to the
Northwest.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Nexus
rooms.Description:
You stand at the nexus of a massive fist of Trollocs.  There must be hundreds of
them here.  A few of the more brave ones step forward to confront you.  To
the south you think you can see the leaders. A foot-trail leads to the north,
and the trail continues to the west.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Foot-trail
rooms.Description:
Here some smarter Trollocs have erected a foot trail leading to a vile
latrine.  The stench of decay and unwashed bodies is unbearable here.  To the
south you see the nexus.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Command Post
rooms.Description:
A huge circle of stones has been made here by the Fades to facilitate
communications with the dark one.  Blood, gore, and bone fragments cover the
entire area.  Several Fades stare at you with a dark gleam in their eyes.  To
the north you see the nexus and to the southwest you see a group of Fades.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Group of Fades
rooms.Description:
A person would have to be crazy or a dark friend to willing come up to these
vile abominations.  You think you see the merchant that comes to Emond's
Field every year talking to the fades.   The aura of evil in this room nearly
chokes you.

rooms.Name: Trollocs Ambush, Along the trail
rooms.Description:
Here the Trollocs stand in lines waiting to be commanded by the Fades.  Most
look bored but a few are having fun torturing a small deer towards the
southern end of the line.  A vile well stands to the north surrounded by
Trollocs. Dark eyes are shining in the darkness to the northeast and
southeast.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Vile Well
rooms.Description:
Although the Trollocs have nearly destroyed the forest in this area, some
wolves have banded together here to try and stop them from the wiping
everything out.  Several dead Trollocs lie here. Dark shapes move to the
southwest.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Bones and pieces of flesh float atop a thick pool of blood.  It looks like
the well is almost completely full of blood.

rooms.Name: Trolloc Ambush, Wolf Den
rooms.Description:
Although the Trollocs have nearly destroyed the forest in this area, some
wolves have banded together here to try and stop them from the wiping
everything out.  Several dead Trollocs lie here. Dark shapes move to the
southwest.  You feel it is safe to rest here, provided you arn't evil like
the Trollocs.

rooms.Name: Trollocs Ambush, Start of a crumbled city
rooms.Description:
You stand at the outskirts of a ruined forest, demolished by the Trollocs.
To the southeast you see the ruins of Shadar Logoth, A place so evil even the
Trollocs shun it.  It has to be safer there then here among the Trollocs.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Entrance
rooms.Description:
Once the proud city of Aridhol, Shadar Logoth is now a festering ruin. A
force known as Mashadar swept through the kingdom and destroyed or enslaved
everyone. Although it has been empty for many hundreds of years, no treasure
seekers have yet to escape alive with any of the treasure of the lost
kingdom. It is said that the proud king of Aridhol still lives here, as a
puppet for Mashdar. You see more streets to the south and east.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, By a tall tower
rooms.Description:
A crumbling tower stands here, long worn smooth by the erosion of many
seasons.  A staircase down to below the street lies beside it.  You swear you
hear, "Come help me carry away my treasure" coming from below the earth.
There are more streets to the west and north.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Dungeon
rooms.Description:
Lit by smoky torches this strange place looks more like a disuse treasury
then a Dungeon. A strange man in royal clothing commands your attention here.
A iron bound door stands here leading to the south.  A spiral staircase
leads back to the street.

Exits.Description: It looks sturdy despite it's age.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Treasure Room
rooms.Description:
Guarded by the fallen king Mordeth, this treasure room contains the lost
treasure of Shadar Logoth. Gold, jewels and many other valuable items
brighten the room by making your light dance on the walls. A iron bound
door leads back to the dungeon.

Exits.Description: It looks very sturdy despite it's age.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Empty street
rooms.Description:
With no citizens the streets of Shadar Logoth are very bare.  Crumbling stone
buildings, and rotted wood lays all around you.  The street continues to the
west and south.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Old town center
rooms.Description:
Once a grand market place, the town center is now empty.  The only sign that
anyone ever lived here is the rotten scraps of wood that were once used to
support various shop keepers awnings. Dark shadows filter around you in all
directions.  To the south you see someone's house. A road continues to the
west.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, someone's house
rooms.Description:
Decaying clothes and a macabre scene of disarray is the only furnishing
adorning this house.  Set for a meal the rotted away several centuries ago a
table sits near the kitchen.  It looks like the family members died and
disintegrated before they could even put down their forks.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, by a Collapsed palace
rooms.Description:
This street is mainly acting as a small headquarters for a very small band of
Trollocs that have been pushed in here by a determined Fade.  A collapsed
palace sits to the north, and a strange fog obscures the south.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Collapsed palace
rooms.Description:
Shards of golden tile, and rich carpet litter the floors of a now collapsed
palace. As you pick your way carefully through the ruble you notice that a
group of fades has set up a small base here to help them command the
Trollocs.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Cloaked in fog
rooms.Description:
Here the road is cloaked in a vile, evil smelling fog.  A million eyes seem
to peer out at you from the obscured ruins.  The road seems to continue to
the Southeast.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Darker Fog
rooms.Description:
The fog here has become a dark whirlwind threating to suck you to the
southeast.  To the northeast the path is split by tendrils of Mashadar.  You
feel like almost certain death awaits you to the southeast.

rooms.Name: The river Taren
rooms.Description:
Finally, you've made it to the center of the river Taren.  Your arms and legs
hurt from the strain it took just to get here.  As your legs give a second
twinge of pain you think how plesant it would be to just stop, and slip
quietly into the abyss.  To the northeast you can see the far bank.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Almost Certain Death
rooms.Description:
You finally understand what killed the people of Shadar Logoth. Too bad it's
ready to kill you.  Here the fog is solid and ready to try and make you one
with Shadar Logoth forever.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Split by Mashadar
rooms.Description:
Thick, opaque fog surrounds you here on three sides.  As you walk through the
ruined streets your path back is completely blocked by the tendrils of
Mashadar. It is said that a single touch of one of the tendrils can kill a
man instantly. Far away in the distance you hear the horns of Trollocs as a
group of Myrddraal push them further into Shadar Logoth.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Doomed Ambush
rooms.Description:
As you walk down the road a group of Trollocs appear from beside a near by
building.  With a demonic sounding noise tendrils of Mashadar snake towards
both you and the Trollocs. It looks like you can flee southeast between a
group of buildings. If you are really dumb, you could also go east and be
killed and eaten alive by tendrils of Mashadar.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Eaten Alive
rooms.Description:
Gee, that was stupid wasnt it. Mashadar surrounds you completely here.  Many
tendrils surround you, eager to take the last remaining bits of your life
away. For some odd reason, a skeleton in one corner of the room bares a red
Star-fleet uniform. After a quick examination of the corpse you find a small
device that might just get you the heck out of here.

ExtraDescs.Description: Oh! Its just that stupid guy that gets killed in every episode.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Between two buildings
rooms.Description:
Several Trollocs chase you as you enter the alley, pushed hard by a
Myrddraal. Above you, tendrils of Mashadar steam forth from the windows of
the buildings, licking eagerly at the on coming Trollocs.  From the northwest
you can hear the sounds of dying Trollocs and Fades as they are completely
consumed by Mashadar.  You can continue to the east, onto a street.  Looks
like there's no turning back.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Mashadars Feast
rooms.Description:
You run quickly to avoid the on rushing tide of Trollocs and deadly fog.
Closing your eyes you rush across the street and smile as you hear the
screams of Trollocs and Myddraal both dying as they are eaten alive by
Mashadar. Steams of blood, black with corruption flow into the gutter.  To
the east, the fog appears to be much lighter.  Traveling west back into
Mashadar isnt advisable.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Empty Street
rooms.Description:
The fog is much less heavy here.  Collapsed buildings on both sides help echo
the screams of the dead and dying legions of the Dark One that so recently
followed you only to be eaten by something far more sinister.  In the
distance you think you hear the sound of running water. The road curves a
little north as it continues east.

rooms.Name: Shadar Logoth, Vine Covered Wall
rooms.Description:
It is clear that at some point this was a grand entrance to the kingdom.  A
huge hole about the size of a small house has been created by the collapse of
the city's once proud gate.  A crumbling marble fountain stands here in the
center of the street, but it appears to have stopped working many years ago.
You may go through the hole to the east.

ExtraDescs.Description: It is huge.

rooms.Name: Dense Forest, Near Arinelle
rooms.Description:
Whew! You finally made it out of Shadar Logoth alive. Here trees have grown
thick, as a sort of natural defense against the evil of Shadar Logoth. Nearby
you hear the sound of rushing water. To your west you see Shadar Logoth, and
to the east the forest continues.

rooms.Name: Dense Forest, by the Arinelle river
rooms.Description:
The sound of rushing water overwhelms you here as you stand atop a tall bluff
above the Arinelle River.  The bluff looks like it is climbable if you would
like to go down and swim across the icy cold waters or you can jump off the
bluff to the east. I hope you can fly.

rooms.Name: West side of the Arinelle
rooms.Description:
As you fall from the bluff icy cold water hits you with brutal force.  Strong
currents rip across against you as you begin the long and dangerous swim.
Branches cover the bluff above you. You think they could be used to climb up,
should you not wish to continue the swim to the east.

rooms.Name: Middle of the Arinelle
rooms.Description:
It is really, really cold here.  Frigid water attacks you on all sides as you
desperately attempt to continue your journey.  To the east you think you see
the bank in the distance.

rooms.Name: East side of the Arinelle
rooms.Description:
After traveling the width of the Arinelle you are now in the water below the
East bank.  Small trees and shrubs provide safe hand holds and foot holds to
climb to the top of the bank.  Better get out of the water quickly, the water
is still as cold as ever.

rooms.Name: Bare Forest, East Bank of Arinelle
rooms.Description:
This side of the Arinelle is more of a field then a forest.  Hearty knee high
grass grows here, sheltering many rabbits and other small mammals. The grass
is only broken occasionally by small clumps of trees. You can climb down the
bank here to swim the Arinelle or you may jump off the bank to the west.  The
forest continues to the east, and a small path leads along the bank to the
south.

rooms.Name: Flying over the Arinelle, Above West side
rooms.Description:
Far below you, the frigid water of the Arinelle flows by.  Stretching for
many miles, the Arinelle is a great source of merchant traffic and a
deterrent to any of the Dark Ones troops that wish to cross. You can continue
flying to the east if you wish to cross the river, or if you made a mistake
you are probably about to crash into the icy water below.

rooms.Name: Flying over the Arinelle, Middle
rooms.Description:
Far below you, the frigid water of the Arinelle flows by.  You can continue
flying to the east if you wish to cross the river, or if you made a mistake
you are probably about to crash into the icy water below.

rooms.Name: Bare Forest, Pile of Cedar Branches
rooms.Description:
Recently a storm hit this area, ripping branches and needles from many of the
non-deciduous trees nearby.  A small strand of evergreens provides a small
amount of cover from the river.  It looks safe here. You can hear the roar of
the Arinelle to the west.

rooms.Name: Bare Forest, Along the bank
rooms.Description:
Small strands of hardwood trees comprise what little cover there is here.
Fear creeps into your heart as you hear the sound of Trolloc horns from the
other side of the bank.  A few must have survived Shadar Logoth.  A trail
leads to the southeast.

rooms.Name: Bare Forest, A small encampment.
rooms.Description:
The trees are much denser here.  Leather leafs and cedars make a woven
curtain blocking any view from the river.  Recently someone camped here.  A
campfire has nearly destroyed a tree here because Egwene forgot to put it
out. Gee that was stupid.  To the east the forest continues.

rooms.Name: Caemlyn Bound, Forest travel part one
rooms.Description:
It's a really long walk to Caemlyn, but it looks like your stuck doing it.
Trees surround you on all sides. Broken tree limbs and the occasional rabbit
run are all that make this part of the forest indistinguishable from any
other part of it. The forest continues to the east.

rooms.Name: Caemlyn Bound, Forest travel part two
rooms.Description:
It seems like trees are the only things around you.  The forest is a little
darker here, as the trees block out the sun. To the north you see some older
looking trees, and to the east you can continue your journey.

rooms.Name: Caemlyn Bound, A mushroom patch in the forest
rooms.Description:
Old, tall trees make the forest almost dark as night here.  Sheltered by the
trees, and dampened by the air, various molds and mushrooms grow here in
abundance.  Among the riff-raff of in-edible mushrooms you think you even see
some of the much sought after Queens Crowns.

rooms.Name: Caemlyn Bound, A ruin on a forested hill
rooms.Description:
Here the forest turns to hills covered in trees. After traveling up and down
a couple of these, you come to a hill with the ruins of stone buildings on
it.  Long reclaimed by the forest, the ruins show no signs that they are of
extreme age.  On the side of one large stone tower you see some writing in
bright red spray paint. The message reads, "Sorry folks, but this is the end
of the zone, for now.  Commit this room to memory, because in the not so
distant future it will be the start of the second half of, The Wheel Turns. "
The doors of a closet are below you, and you think they might just lead to
the dressing room in Midgaard.
